item.title: Dragon Ball Sparking Zero Already Has a Mod for Daima’s Goku Super Saiyan 4
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/dragon-ball-sparking-zero-goku-super-saiyan-4-mod/

Dragon Ball Sparking Zero’s modding community has already created a mod for Goku’s new Super Saiyan 4 transformation from the Daima series. 

Spoilers ahead for the players that haven’t caught up with the new Daima series yet, but Goku reached his iconic Super Saiyan 4 transformation again during the latest episode,’ Awakening’, and the form is canon this time. The new Goku SSJ4 Daima transformation draws a lot of inspiration from its GT counterpart, but it is also different in some ways, such as the colours and Goku still being short. The modders have perfectly captured Goku SSJ4 Daima’s essence in Dragon Ball Sparking Zero. 

Sparking Zero Goku SSJ4 Daima Mod

Spotted by TheGamer, Sparking Zero’s Goku SSJ4 Daima mods have arrived, and the creator has outdone themself with this one, making the character look almost like an official release. The creator, EmiG84, has posted his creations on Patreon and has Daima Super Saiyan 4 transformations for both Goku and Vegeta; you can check them out in action here. If you are wondering how to use mods in Sparking Zero, check out our official guide. 

Goku’s Super Saiyan 4 transformation from Daima may officially arrive for Sparking Zero in the near future. They have already released their first DLC, Hero of Justice, and two more DLCs are planned. One of the two upcoming DLCs will feature Daima characters, officially bringing Goku’s new form to Sparking Zero. 

In other news, Dragon Ball Sparking Zero reached a new milestone of 5 million units sold recently and is one of the best-selling Bandai Namco games. Will you download the Goku SSJ4 Daima mod for Sparking Zero? Let us know in the comments or on our new community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Fortnite receiving new Mortal Kombat mythics next season. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: What is Rainbow Six Siege X? Showcase Date Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/what-is-rainbow-six-siege-x-showcase-date-revealed/

Ubisoft has a big launch on the new through Rainbow Six Siege X—a successor to 2015’s Siege. More original Siege content is on the way, but it looks like Rainbow Six Siege X is replacing its predecessor, and offering big upgrades.

Fun Fact: I got Rainbow Six Siege shortly after release and ended up selling it a few months later because I couldn’t stop playing it. Siege greatly disrupted my single-player gaming, and I decided to end the relationship. I fondly look back on those early days, and 10 years later, the game is as celebrated as ever. It’s a huge esports hit, the gameplay is still strategic and intricate, and tens of thousands of players still hop on each day.

A Siege 2 rumor gained huge traction in January 2025. The leak came to fruition with the announcement of Siege X.

Do we Know The Rainbow Six Siege X Release Date?

There is no release date locked in for Rainbow Six Siege X, nor a vague release period.

Common sense suggests Siege X will likely be released following the conclusion of Rainbow Six Siege Y10. This isn’t factual though, so be sure to check back as we update you.

When is The Rainbow Six Siege X Showcase Date?

The Rainbow Six Siege X Showcase is penciled in for March 13 at 10 AM PT / 6 PM CT / 1 PM ET / 6 PM GMT.

A Ubisoft article confirmed Siege’s X Showcase date. “A new era of Rainbow Six Siege will be revealed on March 13 at the Siege X Showcase,” it said. The Showcase will show us every aspect of Siege X and its new changes compared to the original.

How to Watch Rainbow Six Siege X Showcase

Ubisoft has confirmed you can check out the full Rainbow Six Siege X Showcase by watching the action unfold on the Ubisoft Twitch Channel.

The Ubisoft Rainbow6 Twitch Channel is the home of all things Rainbow Six Siege. So it makes sense for Siege X to be unveiled here. It remains to be seen if any YouTube channels also broadcast the Showcase.

Keep your eyes peeled for alternative sources—as will we.

What is Rainbow Six Siege X?

Rainbow Six Siege X is described as a “major evolution” of Siege, but it isn’t considered a sequel or normal update.

Ubisoft game director Joshua Mills revealed Siege X aims to keep Siege around for the next 10 years. He raised expectations for Siege X at the Rainbow Six Invitational: “It is not Siege 2, and it’s not just another update. It’s a major evolution. We’re expanding and reinforcing the very foundation of Siege to ensure it remains the pinnacle of tactical PvP first-person shooters.”

“Graphical and audio upgrades, deepened tactical gameplay, and new ways to play the game,” are also at the forefront of Siege X’s marketing ahead of the Showcase.

Check out its first teaser trailer below.

I imagine Siege X is following in the footsteps of Overwatch 2 and CS2 by being a massively upgraded free-to-play enhancement of the original. If so, we can start dreaming of the new content, gameplay mechanics, and much more Ubisoft has in store.

It’s no secret Ubisoft needs a big win in the next year. Assassin’s Creed Shadows might not be enough, but Siege continues to do the business. Does the prospect of X get you amped up? Which new features and twists does Siege X need to separate itself from the OG Siege?

Don’t be afraid to jump into Rainbow Six Siege now if you haven’t already. Let’s answer some common questions about Siege: Does it have crossplay? Is cross-progression enabled? And is there a Rainbow Six Siege Campaign?
